posts.name: Anonymous

>>33819580
First of all, it is important to understand that the speed of the Earth's rotation is constant in its own reference frame. That is, if the speeds of objects on Earth are measured, they will be seen to be constant due to the inertia of the objects.

Second, the revolutionary velocity of the Earth around the Sun, while not constant in an absolute reference frame, is constant in a reference frame in which the Sun is at rest. This is known as the Copernican principle of inertia. Copernicus' principle of inertia tells us that a body in motion remains in motion in a straight line unless an external force acts on it.

Third, the independent speed of the Sun does not directly affect the speed of the Earth. The independent speed of the Sun is the speed with which the Sun moves relative to nearby stars, it has no direct relationship to the speed of the Earth.

In conclusion, the statement that the speed of the Earth cannot be constant due to the vector sum of its rotational speed, its revolutionary speed around the Sun, and the independent speed of the Sun is incorrect. Objects on Earth follow the laws of inertia, and Earth velocities can be understood in a proper reference frame.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33819586
Foucault's experiment is a proof of the Earth's rotation that is based on the principle of conservation of angular momentum. It is true that the initial conditions are important in the experiment, since a certain configuration of the elements is required for the experiment to work correctly. However, this does not mean that the experiment is false.

Foucault's experiment is a scientific test that has been replicated many times with consistent results and its effectiveness can be adjusted and measured. It is a physical and empirical demonstration of the Earth's rotation that has been used for more than 150 years to confirm the Earth's rotation.

Furthermore, it is important to note that a scientific proof is not falsifiable just because it depends on initial conditions. Many scientific tests require a specific configuration to be carried out and this does not make them false. Rather than that, it is more important to assess whether the results obtained are consistent with theoretical theories and other independent evidence. Foucault's experiment has been confirmed by other independent scientific tests and its effectiveness has been confirmed through consistent repetition of the results.

The first known to history was Eratosthenes, the method he used was known as the "sun method" or "shading". Basically, it was measured from the difference in angles of the sun in different places. He realized that in a city called Syene, the sun shone directly on a well during the summer solstice, but in his city of Alexandria there was an angle of shadow during that same moment. Knowing that Syene and Alexandria were in a straight line, Eratosthenes measured the length of the shadow on Alexandria and using the angle of the shadow, he was able to calculate the distance between the two cities. From this distance and the angle of the shadow, Eratosthenes was able to calculate the radius of the Earth with amazing precision. Another method used to measure the radius of the Earth is the so-called "parallax method", where the position of the stars at different times of the year is used to calculate the curvature of the earth and, therefore, its radius.

Eratosthenes' measurement is not based on just a stick and stones, but on a series of precise measurements and mathematical calculations. Eratosthenes' method is known as the trigonometric method, and it consists of measuring the angles of the shadow of an object in two different places at the same time, one of them in the city of Syene where it is known that the sun is directly over the city. on a specific day of the year, and another in Alexandria where the angle of the shadow is measured, with this the distance to the sun is calculated and with it the radius of the earth.
Furthermore, it is important to note that this measurement was not made in isolation, but has been confirmed and improved over time by other measurements and experiments, such as satellite measurements, which have given similar results.
In summary, Eratosthenes' measurement is a valid and scientifically confirmed proof, and it is not based only on a stick and some stones, but on a series of precise measurements and calculations.

The formula is:

R = d / θ

where R is the radius of the Earth, d is the distance between Syene and Alexandria and θ is the angle formed between the three mentioned positions.

Eratosthenes measured the distance between Syene and Alexandria in units of measurement of his time (estimated at 800 km) and the angle by measuring the height of a pole in Alexandria.

>>33820118
According to some sources, Eratosthenes estimated the distance between Syene and Alexandria at 800 km, and by measuring the height of a stick in Alexandria, he obtained an angle of 7.2 degrees between the axis of the shadow and the vertical. Using these data, we can approximate the calculation of the radius of the Earth:

R = d / θ

R = 800 km / 7.2 degrees

However, we must keep in mind that these data are approximations and are not the precise data that Eratosthenes used in his original calculation. In addition, the radius of the earth is a subject in constant study and measurement, for which the values may vary, but in general it is estimated at about 6,371km.

>>33815242
There are 3 parts to your mind
>Conscious mind (ego)
>Subconscious mind (a.k.a. the deep mind)
>Superconscious mind (your "higher self", the most Godly part of you that has "perfect" ideas)

Your conscious mind interacts with the physical world, and tries to guide you with logic and reasoning. This is a double-edged sword, because on the one hand, you can learn from mistakes, but you can also suffer if you dwell on mistakes. You end up with thoughts like "you can't do this", or "see? you're such a bad person because you did this" and so on because of past events.

To answer your question, desires are a result of the conscious mind reacting to the world. For example, you come across a person that bothers you, and so the conscious mind gets your mind thinking about how to deal with the situation. It might suggest to become more reclusive and avoid that person. Maybe it will steer you to hate that person and attack them so that they go away. It could even make you think that you want the person dead. At the heart of it all, your ego is correct in that you don't want to be around that person, but your duty is to reel in the ideas that it creates reactively.

To take it one step further, your superconscious mind, seeing things from the point of view of the spirit realm, does not consider the past. When you need (spiritual, higher) guidance for "big" problems, you want to tap into this part of your mind to get the solution, where all your doubts are ignored.

>>33818173
>Would you agree that the higher consciousness would need to be in agreement with the conscious desire being impressed on the subconscious
No, actually. Your conscious mind is put in relatively strong control for the purpose of keeping you alive. It can usually override any higher or lower impulses if it needs to. I say usually because addictions and manias are a thing.

I have heard about people using override techniques to talk to people's "higher selves" to negotiate what they want from that level of the person to enforce on the others but I suspect that requires people to accept the idea of "higher self knows better than me" which I do not subscribe to and my higher self would not agree with anyway.

My experience is the conscious mind is a filter for the subconscious. If you are able to allow a thought to pass through it is done, the subconscious treats it as "approved/safe" when it comes through regardless of whether it really is or not.

For many years i suffered from weekslong episodes of chronic nightmares to the point where in the childhood and adult life i've faced times where i feared sleep. Sometimes you'll have a dream that is so wrong and unnerving and terrifying that you wonder where the shit comes from.

You have the "brain recycling information from the day" notion that hopeless rationalists will stick to, but what part of my day did i see hear about or think about a dozen mangled fetuses scattered among naked trees, or secret passage ways in my house to an alternate family?

I worked in Maine as a blueberry picker and general farmhand, and would sleep in a cabin in a wooded clearing. I would have dreams about the witch sometimes, and being eternally stalked. here is the main one i remember from this time, the chronology might be jumbled because i haven't thought about it for some time, ive actually been sleeping well for the past few months.

>wake up
>the type of frozen in terror wake up
>the kind thats like when youre really little, and youre sure the thing in the dark is watching but you dont know what to do about it so just push yourself into bed under the blanket as tight as you can type of feeling
>there are extra windows and doors in the cabin now
>they're all open
>this is unnerving because i always close all the windows and everything to get to sleep
>even the thought of my lamp being visible through all the cracks in between the lumber in the walls was bad enough at night

from that point i remember things starting to happen, like i knew she was coming, doors starting creaking or whatever, but ultimately it led to every door and window being slammed over and over deafening me

>yell to stop with "enough of this" shit tone
>it stops after a minute of saying that
>i book it across the field and through the bracken to bosses house to try and find another human being in all the chaos

1/?

I lay in bed 12 hours, half asleep, half awake, seeing the same thing (I could, at the same time, see things that happened in the room, my phone getting a message, a car driving by, early in the morning birds on the porch, so I knew I was half awake)
Anyway, the towers changed hight according to what I had in mind and I could only think of the absolutely fucked faces in the sky. The towers would change if I imagined/pictured the correct faces and I somehow knew I had to get all towers to the same hight, so I tried, despite imagining the faces being absolutely fucking horrible and hurting my physically.
I could not stop "dreaming" or thinking about that until my girlfriend awoke me 12 hours later.
It´s still in the back of my mind, always and fucks me up. Easily the worst night of my life, despite me literally having one night were I thought I was dying this year, to a point where I wrote goodbye-messages.

I first saw it when I was 5. This was in probably 1976 or therabouts. This was way before all these shows on this sort of shit. I woke up in the middle of the night and saw the fucking thing looking in my window. As a small child i was obviously terrified. I got up and ran to my parents room telling them there was a man looking in the window. Dad told me to go back to sleep and I got in bed with them.

That was it. Never saw it again but could not stop thinking about it the rest of my life.

I'm fifty now and a few years ago I started to become obsessed with this again. Thought maybe I saw some shadow beings in my current house but it was real fleeting.

Now it gets weird. One time on a lark I gave my cat a little piece of magic mushroom. Not much so don't flip out on me.Well she was having a pretty good time then goes to the door where I kept thinking I saw that thing and she stands there and hisses at something around the corner.

This really scared the shit out of me. I'm getting goose bumps right now typing it up.

I started to feel like I was being watched constantly. One time I even spoke into the darkness where I felt I was being watched from and said "I know you are there"....no response

Finally I started looking into it. Found Heidi Hollis and she told me how to do a cleanse of my house. Heidi while a good person is a devout Christian which is something I just refuse to get into. According to Heidi and most people you need the power of jeebus to dispell these.

I did the ceremony Heidi told me but without the jesus shit. Basically you have to imagine the fucking thing is like a puff of smoke, an entity composed of smoke that could hide in any small part of your house. You have to go around the house starting at the point furthest from the front door and blow sage smoke all over spray the wall....cont

posts.name: Anonymous

cont...

spray the walls with a scented oil of some sort. All the while screaming 'GET OUT OF MY HOUSE"

Anyways I go through this entire ceremony. It starts felling weirder and weirder. Finally I get to the front door and I'm so terrified I'm almost ready to cry. I'm a fairly large guy. six three and 250, probably heavier thn. I'm telling you I was scared shitless when I got to that front door. I could feel the fucking thing standing right in front of me.

posts.com:
Rambling post about thoughts I'm having;
Yin yang style opposites are not only a mark of taoism. Though Daoism is the most well known for this crucial hallmark of it.
Buddhism, however, also has this feature within it. Not only within areas that understandably would have been subject to overt daoist influence, but in areas where it would be unlikely to have a stronghold or significant influence at all.
This is interesting to me because I rather like the way that the hot and cool life energy system is used to organize natural phenomena in the world (external and internal).
Particularly I've been thinking about the usage of the yin yang for describing the way the current global political system is organized.
According to both the buddhist and daoist complimentary-opposing energies model, the world is currently suffering from an overabundance of yang (heat, method, control, compassion) energy/mindset as the way to manage our general reality.
Yang in overabundance manifests as rigid mental constructs and a general need to control and organize everything into absolutes. Excess of yang needs to dominate everything and assign it an exact role and box to fit into in order for it to be managed. Nothing can be 'outside' of the box, because if it is, it has to be brought in and made containable and thus rigid.
What really makes this neat to me is that from my point of view it describes our modern world politics very well. Everything is being approached from a 'yang' perspective, we see this maybe the most in both gender/sexual identity spheres and women's right's movements. Whether they are pro these things or against them, both 'sides' feature a fascinating rejection of 'yin' as foreign and dangerous.
I am of the belief that observant people will also notice this come into play with how the global west treats things such as psychology, religion/secularism.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33819953
What really made this idea click into place for me was reading a comment somewhere online which said that they believed the setting of adventure time was an example of a world where the divine feminine (yin) won as the dominant point of view. I know this might be a bit silly to some people as an example, but I think it's a very good one when compared to how our own world here functions. If adventure times world is one wherein the 'feminine' energy (wisdom, passivity, coolness, creativity) won and went to it's excess imbalance (martyrdom, depression, confusion, needyness, stagnation), then our own world is one wherein yang (compassion, method, heat, action) has won and went to it's excess imbalance (domination, aggression, rigid mental constructs, anxiety, forcing).
That's all, I just think this is cool as a way to analyze and understand things happening around us in an esoteric/spiritual lense.

Reading order below was like an eye-opening journey for me:

1. "The Rebirth of Pan" by Jim Brandon

2. "Goblin Universe" by Ted Holiday & Colin Wilson

3. "The Trickster and The Paranormal" by G. P. Hansen.

4. "The Holographic Universe" by Michael Talbot

5. "Stalking the Wild Pendulum" by Itzhak Bentov

6. "The Case Against Reality" by Donald D. Hoffman

Starting with pretty much full on paranormal and crazy stuff, softly going into philosophy and sociology, drifting through physics and mathematics, ending with neurology and how it all becomes real.

I really recommend this. Have a good one.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33807870
I really appreciate Beksinski's work. He was an "outsider artist" with no formal training. Outsider artists are fascinating to me. I have a feeling if he received formal instruction in painting they would have hampered his creativity to make him a "proper" artist. The man himself said something like "My style is the result of the deficiencies of my psyche." Also he didn't need to make any money off of his art either, he had a day job as an architect (which lends a lot towards his buildings and perspective IMO). Basically he was able to capitalize on his own vision for everything he made, that's why he's so distinctive.

I had the thought the other day that it was a shame he died relatively early in life (Polish problems). I wonder how his style would have evolved had he lived through the 2000s.

>Assuming you're real, are you privy to any massive secrets or conspiracies in the American government?
No. The secrets I know are limited to information relating to ongoing operations or activities I was involved in that have yet to be declassified, even then some of these have been revealed by other sources and aren't exactly secrets anymore. Also information in the CIA is highly compartmentalized, so if you're not involved in the activities in that particular region in the world, administrative, or on the ground otherwise, then you're going to know little to nothing about it.

I was involved in a massive international incident though that took place from 2019-2020, however. While not declassified, proof of our involvement and funding has been publicly revealed by news sources. This incident also turned out to be one huge mess and failure, and was the lowest point in my once promising career, and is the reason I'm considering early retirement.

I am also very desensitized to death at this point in my life, perhaps that has a lot to do with these premonitions fading away, despite death occurring more regularly due to age. >>33818268
Had a similar thing where i was going home at night after a party and passed trough a wood area, i grew up there so i know that place perfectly, just had to pass the wood until i reach the road and then follow it to my house
It was uphill i started getting tired climbing for a while, midway thought i heard a noise so i stopped and listen didn't really think much of it
Thought it was a good place to take a breath, after my 3-4 minutes rest i continue to go up the hill until i reach the road, rested another 5 minutes on the side of the road
As i was getting ready to continue toward my home i hear a fucking heavy sound, like a growl from an animal right where i came from (but quite far), sounded like a cow or something like that but very "heavy" idk how to put it, i wasn't scared i just thought what the fuck is a cow doing here at night lol
The growl continued, it got closer, i started hearing branches cracking and some tumbling in the woods at that point i started getting scared ngl, started walking back home.
As i was walking the sound didn't stop, i was getting away from it but it definitely was still here i started running home and that was it.

Kinda not /x/ i guess must have been a cow or a horse with a broken leg or something, there is no other wild animals where i live exept maybe boars so maybe that was it, wasn't drunk at all i had like two beers
I investigated the place a week later with my sister and some friends, found nothing (i expected the body of a dead animal somewhere)
Still think about it from time to time, that sound was extremely unsettling, haven't heard anything like it before or since.

posts.name: Puppy
posts.com:
Suicide is best considered morally as an act of murder committed against an undeserving victim. The psycho-spiritual manifestation of you at one particular moment is responsible for the wellbeing and destiny of your soul which cannot readily make its bests interests understood and known to the canal mind. So much of our thought and behaviour is poison to the soul but the carnal mind cares more about immediate pleasure and comfort while being largely ignorant to its detrimental impact. Suicide is the carnal mind in a state of discomfort (pain) reacting by choosing death as a remedy in the erroneous belief that it will be a state of peace or non-existence and this not pain. However, the soul is eternal and will carry on in the spiritual realm and either go on astral safari for a while and eventually reincarnate or go down into captivity in "the middle"/hell. The suffering that was the cause of choosing suicide was being afflicted upon the person because of a large outstanding debt of sin/karma accumulated in their current life or possibly a previous one. Death doesn't wipe the debt and murdering yourself only incurs a whole lot more debt. The suffering will play out in life or in death and there is no escaping repayment. God's mercy and grace will discount the debt to a great extent for those who repent and change their ways, humble themselves, appeal for mercy and act merciful and forgiving towards others. Suicide is just a massive lose/lose in any situation. Obviously God is very compassionate and understands when suicide is more forgivable due to severe circumstances or impaired judgement but when it's done carelessly, selfishly and unjustifiably it's considered a pretty low act.

Euthanasia to avoid prolonged, painful death is pointlessly kicking the can down the road. The suffering that was marked for you will still be waiting for you.

Our soul is actually marked in different places as a result of our sins. Thats the meaning behind being made/becoming "spotless"

posts.name: Puppy
posts.com:
I understand your carefully considered view but it's based on assumptions that derive from limited understanding.

There is unbeknownst to most, an important purpose to this mortal life. We are created as souls from the eternal divine source and are placed in a state of separation from it. By being stripped of completeness and cast into a state of ignorance, impotence and finiteness we are given the gift of discovering and regaining our infinite, unified nature, experiencing all its beauty, awe and majesty as if for the first time. It is a long journey and transcends a single mortal life. From here you can't readily see the terrain beyond and the greater landscape and journey you are on. Reunification can only be done in the mortal, worldly existence and far from coming easy there are many trials and lessons to learn along the path and it is long and hard. Our one goal that counts is reunification - getting back home. It is unimaginably greater than any experience that can be had in this world and we must do it. So using every bit of mortal life you are granted to pursue the spiritual path is paramount. Suicide is throwing it away and achieves nothing good. It's not laudable or courageous it's exactly the opposite. Enduring life to its bitter end takes strength of will and resilience. If you feel there's nothing left for you in life and suicide is rational you have just lost your inspiration, drive and abundance of spirit. Your "cup" is empty so to speak. But it doesn't have to be. We can get it back in bucketloads if we seek it. At any age.

This kind of twisting around something bad and lowly into something righteous and good typifies the current sick state of the world. It's self deception and delusion. But I once thought like that too so I understand your feeling. But I was very wrong and living in ignorance.

>>33817741
First hand account:

"At dawn on November 12, 1976, two soldiers (José María Trejo and Juan Carrizosa Luján), claimed to have seen and shot at a being of unknown origin at the Base Aérea de Talavera la Real (Talavera la Real Air Base), located in the Spanish province of Badajoz. Both were on patrol at 1:45 am, when they heard a noise similar to radio interference which later became an acute whistle. When it ceased five minutes later, they spotted an intense bright light in the sky, that lasted 15 seconds. Another guard arrived with a guard dog and all began searching around the area. Eventually, they heard the sound of eucalyptus twigs being broken. The dog was released and rushed to the place where the noise was coming from, but returned sick, a process which was repeated a couple of times. Eventually, the dog started to circle them, (a technique meant to protect guard dogs' handlers). Trejo then allegedly spotted a human-shaped green light to his left. The being was about 3 meters tall. It seemed to be formed of small light points, and the brightness was more intense along its edges. The head was small and covered by something resembling a helmet. The arms were very long and had no apparent hands or feet. Trejo fainted; after which his colleagues opened fire at the creature. 40 to 50 bullets were fired, but the being simply disappeared. While Trejo was being assisted, the same sound as before was heard. The next morning, 50 men searched the whole area but found no bullet casings or bullet holes. However, the Air Force concluded that the soldiers did fire their guns."

You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

>>33806643
>How do i know if it's lucid dreaming or not?
You recognize a "full blown lucid dream" by your mental clarity, not what you're able to do. In full lucid dreams you have the same kind of sharp thinking as in real life, able to fully self-reflect and process thoughts as in waking life. In what you call dreams ibetween it's more like you're a zombie with a vague notion that there are no consequences for your actions.

Fuck you.

DAILY REMINDER - GPS absolutely proves globe Earth, rotating Earth, space, orbiting satellites, time dilation (relativity), and gravity.

Flerfers will point to LORAN and claim that GPS could work off of transmitters sitting on the ground, on balloons, or on airplanes. But it cannot.

Why? I'm glad you asked.

In tracking mode GPS receivers use Doppler signal analysis to determine receiver velocity. It is impossible for a transmitter to fake Doppler signal shift across 360°. If the transmitter was lying about its speed, then the receiver would think that it was moving at high mach based on the incorrect Doppler shift in the signal. And since GPS is computed in 3D space from four satellite signals, if the satellites were lying about their positions (altitudes) the resulting location and altitude on the receiver would be off by thousands of miles.

This means that GPS satellites are provably at orbital altitudes and speeds, because GPS could not function at all if the satellites were lying. And if the satellites aren't lying, then space is real. Orbits are real. But the dome is not real. Not unless the satellites punched through it.

What about Earth's shape? GPS receivers use a spherical model of Earth. If Earth was really flat, then receivers would report altitudes literally thousands of miles off. This means Earth really is a sphere.

Furthermore, both Earth's rotation and time dilation must be accounted for in GPS. If either one was not true then, once again, receivers would give obviously false and useless results. That means Earth really is rotating. And time dilation is real. And if both orbits and time dilation are real, that pretty much guarantees that gravity is real.

No single instrument completely shatters all of flat Earth mythology quite like the GPS constellation. It really is a beautiful thing.

Well, let's do some basic math flerfy. Taking the numbers from google, the moon exerts all of 3 newtons of gravitational pull on the earth.
A shit ton of mass, over a bigger amount of distance squared, throw in the GC.
That is all of 0.003 m/s acceleration towards the moon. No. You would not feel it.
Why do we get tides then? It's complicated, but basically it comes down to aggregate action on the water.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pwChk4S99i4
Jump to minute 4 if you want to skip the pre-amble, but long story short: the water at the poles is pushing down towards the earth. But it's also, ever so slightly, pushing towards the moon because the moon is pulling it.
Which is pushing into water molecules that is, likewise, being pulled towards the moon. It's an aggregate force and that's why lakes don't have much of a noticable tidal affect. (The great lakes experience all of 5 centimeters of tidal affect. Amazing, innit?)

Now, as for the moon being tidally locked with the earth: That's also true for mercury, which is locked towards the sun.
And I think quite a few of Jupiter's moons. The reason is very simple, the moon is *not* perfectly even with the mass distribution. As such, in the past it may not have been tidally locked, but its rotation has slowed to the point that it is now. Now you might ask: Where did the energy go? The answer is the rotational energy is lost due to internal friction on the moon.

Also fun fact, the moon in fact does have a (negligable) atmosphere. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atmosphere_of_the_Moon

>>33813225
FLERFERS LIE

Take a close look at the attached pic. Flerfers often post it as proof the Earth is flat. Why do I want you to look at it? Because it's a lie.

"The Australian Black Swan" tells you that the maximum line of sight for a 5.5ft tall observer is 2.35 miles. But the cliff is 7.8 miles away. So what's wrong with this flat Earth "proof"? *** Line of sight depends on both observer and target height, as well as on atmospheric refraction. *** The lighthouse is at least 100ft tall which means the visible cliff is at least 400ft tall. LoS for a 5.5ft observer of a 500ft (combined height) target is 35 miles.

What about the oil platforms? Ocean oil platforms have an "air gap" between the ocean and the first deck of 40-60 feet. Observer height was listed as 1ft (camera on the ground?). With a 40ft first deck the line of sight is 10 miles. With a 60ft first deck it's 12 miles. With a 5ft observer and a 60ft first deck it would be 14 miles.

At 6.21 and 9.41 miles you would still see the entire structure above the first deck even if the first deck was only 40ft off the ocean and the camera really was on the ground at 1ft. For the closer platform you would see some structure below the first deck. Note that we see more of the closer rig, proving curvature.

Here's a line of sight calculator: http://www.calculatoredge.com/electronics/lineofsight.htm

>but we're talkin' about muh horizon
>MUH HORIZON IS TOO FAR AWAY!
No it's not. It's between the observer and target in both photos. That's why the observer cannot see the very bottom of the target.

When the Sun and moon are close to the same line, Spring Tides happen as the tidal forces add up.

Sure we do.

Go up a mountain or a very tall building, can you see the ground further away before your line of sight reaches the horizon? Then the surface is curved, not flat.

Watch the moon rise and set. Does the moon dwindle away into the distance and always stay several degrees above the horizon, or does it stay the same size and visibly set beyond the horizon? If the later, the moon does not endlessly orbit over a flat Earth, but goes around a sphere.

Get some friends in different cities to track satellites with you (several good free aps are available.) Do they appear in each city at exactly the time and direction predicted? If so, then you can show they are moving at around 17,000 miles an hour. They are not balloons as flatists claim, balloons don't go 17,000 mph. You can watch them enter and leave the sunlight as they move into and out of the Earth's shadow, exactly as required by the globe model but impossible on the flat Earth. (Can't say flat Earth model, since they have no model -- they cannot even make a map of the world with a scale because the distances would be wrong all over the place since you can't map a globe onto a flat surface without distortions.)

Claiming we can't KNOW for ourselves is a cop out -- it takes a minimal amount of effort, yes, but it is not particularly hard.

/x/, I've had a delusional manic episode (or what seemed to be one) in mid-2022. I've let myself completely heal, and it's one of the most significant experiences I've had in my life. It can be seen as even more beneficial than psychedelic experiences, as I've grown to have an even deeper understanding of how my head works. I found a complete comfort in nihilism, a comfort in a world that is in it's technocapital decline, and a comfort in knowing that I am subjected to a dopaminic system with no free will and with the fact everything is preordained.

On the onset of this episode, I knew deeply well that I'm on a decline to cognitive disorganization. I was thinking about the concept of Jungian individuation, which is somewhat of an integration to psychosis as to achieve a sense of self-actualization. I wanted to take a deep dive into the idea of "transcendent function", and so I've taken a dose of sativas and began to accelerate the process of my psychotic episode. For a minute I thought that it was the worst decision I've ever made, but I quickly came to the realization that I've made the best one.

I was immediately seeing the world differently. I had control over effecting the system of the outside world and the system of my very own body. Both of these however have soon repressed against me, but I was fighting back by making even more unconscious adjustments to them. I could talk about what specifically happened, but it isn't necessarily too important. (cont.)

posts.name: Psychoaccelerator
posts.com:
The problem with hospitalization is that there's no ability to interact with the outside world, barely any ability to socialize with a wider range of people, and the antipsychotic medications were lobotomizing me (and literally have caused brain damage for several months). The process of psychosis was being completely slowed, and had I not been hospitalized I absolutely would've figured things out sooner. It's problematic because it obviously slows the process of psychosis, and it isn't let forward even though in this whole process I've never once thought about hurting others or myself. It was only when I got discharged that these specific delusions immediately stopped, because I saw that the world was the same. I started to cry really bad.

The substance of everything started to change conceptually once more, under lucidity this time. The infrastructure, culture, communications, all of it wouldn't have been made if we weren't subjected to this dopaminic system inside of our heads. I didn't know what to think of this, but as I started to heal I went to a form of acceptance of it. Because at the end of time, none of this is in my control — and this very functionality of control for anything isn't in my control either. I started to be a lot less anthropocentric, and stopped thinking that my choices have some form of "will" to it. This didn't lead me into being some sad fuck, but rather I feel content with everything.

posts.name: Psychoaccelerator
posts.com:
>>33820819
Anyways, the reason why I wanted to bring this up is because I want people to think about critiquing the idea of slowing down psychotic episodes, and instead to come up with an approach to push it forward. To give yourself in and let yourself go through the process. I need all of you to bear in mind that you need to know yourself GOOD before you do this, and it can practically be as risky as doing psychedelics. Just because there's a secondary approach doesn't mean you should take it, but it also means it's able to be taken into consideration. Personally, knowing myself on absolutely not harming myself or other people (which is basically the most important aspect of this), I've decided to do it and it happened to be almost completely beneficial.

I want to call it "Psychoaccelerationism (p/acc)", where it emphasizes the acceleration of psychosis as a means to achieve personal development and self-transcendence. Proponents of this idea should argue that by embracing and accelerating the process of psychosis (or other cognitive-related phenomenon, psychosis doesn't have to be the only thing that's involved but it also isn't really transhumanism), individuals can breakthrough their limitations and approach a better state of being. The most important part of this idea is that it shouldn't be a singular solution to all psychotic disorders, but rather as an option, unlike some of the other subsets of accelerationism that propose to be "the only one". An obvious difference as well is that this absolutely isn't as political as general accelerationism.

All thoughts and opinions are this are fine, but it would also be nice for this thread to be a little thinktank for this idea (and maybe extend beyond the communications of 4chan if that's possible).

>Feel free to suggest resources
Resources:
Books:
- Liber Lilith by Donald Tyberson
A Gnostic Grimoire and Novel
https://www.pdfdrive.com/liber-lilith-a-gnostic-grimoire-e185231845.html
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams
No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission. Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason
https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
This one is a collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. Part grimoire, part reverence. Contains art and accounts by different people.

Videos:
Who is Lilith? Ancient Origins by Esoterica
https://youtu.be/n1EKccz4fS0
A fairly extensive history on her historical origins
The Untold Truth of Lilith by Grunge
https://youtu.be/01guwJbp_ug
A short video intended for a popular audience
Goes over her myth and general nature
Goddess Lilith - What she likes, how to contact
https://youtu.be/75bnMRPRiDk
A simple, short to the point video that rings true to my experiences.
My Experiences Workiing with Lilith
https://youtu.be/EHol9LrpWks
One woman's account of her experience

For me it's been partially the opposite. Since working with her recently, I've been confronted with bisexual urges, and I'm still unsure how to reconcile them. It hasn't gotten to the point of feeling attracted to women in person, but nonetheless, my spiritual experiences lately have me questioning my sexual orientation.

It's embarrassing to admit, but I used to find women somewhat repulsive. I've always admired those who exemplify masculine virtues, and often saw women as the opposite, taking advantage of men's strength like parasites, subconsciously seducing their will just to satisfy their own needs. And I felt deeply ashamed of my sexuality as I recognised that same neediness within myself.

Even so, I still had to deal with gender dysphoria somehow. I already sought help from others when I was 14, but even then I could only wait as I lost things that felt important to me. But when I was 17, perhaps in a lapse of judgement, I turned to the occult. It was just a prayer to attempt to form a pact, and not even directed towards anyone in particular. But since then, my life began to change drastically, and I found relief that I didn't even think was possible.

As the wish I'd once made reached a satisfactory conclusion, and Lilith offered to guide me towards a new purpose, I thanked her and began to show my appreciation for her more. I thought I accepted myself now that I'm finally at peace with my body, only to feel lost again as spiritual experiences confront me with all sorts of sides of myself that I don't know how to reconcile. I'd have been content to ignore them for the rest of my life, but now I'm unsure how I'm supposed to proceed anymore. And although I recall her offer to guide me, I'm reluctant as I fear I'll be forced to face even more.

That's what I get for being dishonest with myself; for being so easily seduced as my contradictions are exposed.

>>33737944
I always struggled to relate to transgender people. Dysphoria was primarily a physical thing for me that ceased after my surgery, so I find the focus on stereotypes asinine and childish.

Two years ago, my older brother asked me to strangle his neck as hard as I can. He was curious if his neck muscles are stronger than my arms. I refused as it made me uncomfortable.
A year later, I felt scared as I realised how weak I am physically. But when I told my fiancé that I wanted to try building abs to boost my confidence, he was against it; he said he dislikes muscles on women. I lost motivation, as I realised I can never be as strong as him anyway.

I dislike alcohol, but knowing I'm way too hard on myself, I drank half a glass of champagne yesterday, hoping it would loosen me up a bit. The results were as agonising as I expected. It was far too little for me to lose control, but it became slightly harder for me to suppress my unwanted emotions. As they raged inside of me, I snuck away from my family and isolated myself. I forced myself to remain silent and still, but the storm inside only worsened.

When I returned, my brother noticed I was tense. He said to let out my anger by hugging him as hard as I can. So I embraced him, as if trying to crush him.
In that moment, I felt glad I'm physically weak. "I don't have to hold back. I don't have be afraid I'll hurt others, if this is all I can do", I thought.
But then, he said repeatedly: "You're strong. Those hormones didn't affect you nearly as badly as I thought." He sounded so relieved.

My brother is the strongest man I know. If I can be strong in his eyes even without training after 7 years of having less testosterone than most women, then I shouldn't belittle myself.
So I've decided to start working out and learn martial arts. It doesn't matter if I won't be as strong as I'd have been as a man; transitioning gave me other things that are more important to me. Even so, I still want to become my best self.

I attempted physical transmutation a few years ago, as I was curious whether it might work. However, I discontinued my efforts after a few weeks, as it caused severe inflammation and pieces of dead skin falling off in a particular area. Not only was the pain becoming unbearable, but I realised what I was doing was highly dangerous, as it was becoming difficult to even urinate. After discontinuing my magick, which consisted of daily energy work in a deep trance, the symptoms subsided in just a day.

My conclusions are that it's far more efficient to change physical things by physical means, and spiritual things by spiritual means. Not only that, but it's dangerous to attempt to remove body parts with magick; it's no different from convincing those parts of your body to destroy themselves, with no guarantee of actually getting the results you want. In my experience, physical surgery is both safer and much less painful in comparison. However, based on other results I got such as a sudden spurt of breast growth, I do think it can be useful for healing.

You posted here a while ago and clarified that you're not interested in physically transitioning, nor in changing spiritually. Perhaps it could be useful for you to try to understand why you think you want to be a biological woman, and find (other) positive ways for you to fulfil the underlying needs.

>>33792328
>crisis of faith
I haven't even read LL, and I still feel like that sometimes. Earlier today, someone asked me to pray for him, and it took me a few minutes to gather my resolve to request Lilith's assistance. I managed to stay calm by recalling that I've never felt malice from her, and that she only helped me get what I wanted.

What I've realised lately is that what I fear isn't really her, but rather things within myself that I'm afraid of as I don't understand them, then project outwards onto her. And as those projections don't appear to be wrong, I come to fear her instead of myself. But then I see her expressing those things that I couldn't accept about myself in such positive ways instead, and I begin to realise it was my fears that caused those sides of me to come out in the wrong ways in the past. When it's coming from her in such a calm and dignified manner, she makes it look so natural, and I realise I can be like that too.

What I thought to be so monstrous and feared, turned out to be womanhood; in the most unapologetic sense, unfiltered by society's expectations. It's embarrassing to admit that I got those things mixed up, and it's honestly a lot to take in. But as I come to understand her, and myself, the fear fades away.
Of course, men nor women are inherently good or bad. But people can get so lost as they misunderstand each other, and themselves in turn. If they feel ashamed of things that are perfectly natural, it saddens my heart. It's useful to know what's socially acceptable, but people mustn't lose themselves.

I don't know if that relates at all to the fear in your own heart, but I feel like I understand it in a way. As people idealise others from their own limited perspective, they're in fact rejecting the parts they don't understand; then if those misunderstandings are revealed, that can be very shocking or even frightening.

>>33803716
Most people are never truly tested, and I think part of the reason why we no longer teach each other to seek out these spiritual tests is it turns out you can actually fail them. Permanently.

If you truly in your soul desire to be a good and just person who walks in the light, you'll be saved, right? Well what if you don't truly desire to be good and just?
What would you do if faced with oblivion, knowing that you had long since strayed from a path you didn't believe in?

I believe most people, even the rich, desire to be good and spread love and all that. There are some, however, who desire only to wallow in spiritual excrement. They have learned how to feed on others and it makes them feel whole.

The choice came to me, once. I had been made to believe that there was no good in the world, and all other humans were evil. I had been tricked into thinking that I was the last person still holding on to hope; a misguided ape hurtling through a dead universe. I believed that all was lost and there was nothing for me but the knowledge that I had been abandoned by the entire universe. In that moment, I was tested. My resolve held, and I decided that even if I was the last and only person trying to be good, I would still not give in. In the absolute bottom of the pit of despair, my hope could not be crushed.

As soon as I made that choice and cried out saying that I wouldn't be swayed no matter what, it was like a signal to everything which side I had chosen. That was the most difficult thing I have ever done and to say it was an ordeal is putting it lightly.

While I eventually found my way out of that... pit, the thought occurred to me that not everyone would be able to make that choice. I was willing to be alone for eternity before I would follow an evil being. For certain, some would not find the same resolve that I had. Especially if they're tested before they've matured.

I feel like I know the answer to this question but I'm not sure I can put it into words, and I doubt many would find it satisfying. For "nothing" to exist, "something" also has to exist, for the concept of one is relative to the concept of the other. In other words, existence simply is. Everything simply is. There is no beginning or end. Infinity exists because it's impossible for it not to exist. This same logic applies to everything, and it's exactly why reality appears to have fractal, holographic properties.

When you try to comprehend infinity with logic, all you can do it cut it up into smaller and smaller parts. To wrap your mind around any concept you have to think in terms of relationships and patterns. What it is, what it isn't, what it has or doesn't have in common with anything else, etc. So the more you try to use intellect, the more impossibly complex it becomes.

Ultimately you can't really explain it or understand in logical terms, only experience it. Everyone who reaches a deep enough stage of meditation eventually experiences this first hand and comes to understand it in their own way. Hopefully this made sense to someone on here.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33812401
That poster is misinformed and larping, ignore them. Lotus position variations are prolific in the east purely out of convenience. It comes naturally for children, so as long one keeps using the position into their adulthood it's easy. It can use it anywhere without a chair or cushion. Progressing to a full lotus simply makes the position more stable, making it easier to remain upright, which is primarily so one doesn't fall asleep as easily. All that matters is:
>neutral spine
>comfortable/not distracted by body
>can stay awake
That's it. And even that isn't actually necessary for the advanced mediator, it just makes meditation much easier. Allegedly, the Buddha left this world through mahasamadhi while laying down. If lying down is good enough for meditation for the Buddha, it's good enough for us. Sitting up right in a comfortable chair is fine too, as long as you can stay awake.
>source: Thai Buddhist friend who has been meditating for ~40 years

One time I was going for a walk in the woods on a pitch black cloudy night, running on pure sonar.
Ahead of me, at about 20 meters there was the distinct sound of bipedal footsteps approaching.
*CLICK CLICK CLICK* sonar returns indicate a roughly humanoid shape, it comes to a stop when it hears the sonar.
I call out to it, "Go away or I'm gonna kill ya.".
It takes a step forward.
I draw my side-arm and fire one round at it's center-of-mass.
I hear the soft thud of a bullet striking flesh, there's that sort of "surprised quiet exhalation sound" then the sound of a being slumping up against the tree nearby, then confused footsteps going the other direction.
I did not pursue.
To this day I don't know what I dropped hammer on, but I fuckin' warned 'em, whatever they were.

>>33819950
What do you think that would be like? That things which previously filled you with fear simply wouldn't anymore? Or that it would feel different?
In either of those cases that's not overcoming fear itself, that's just avoiding or transmuting it.

The feeling of fear is fixed, if you're not feeling it then it's not fear.
Conscious feelings like fear are their own meaning. Fear cannot be anything other than fear.
So there is no "overcoming" it while still feeling it at the same time (which means there's no overcoming it, period).

Instead, why don't you quesiton the beliefs you have that are leading you to this idea that you have to overcome it? Are those beliefs really healthy for you?
If someone is telling you that all you can do is "overcome" something you dislike then isn't that someone kind do of implying you're powerless?

Don't seek to overcome fear, seek to overcome the lack of control over your own existence that led you to think you had to overcome fear in the first place.

>>33797704
The Ascendant Ruler is the planet that rules the rising sign, in your case Saturn. It marks out an area of special interest for your life. In your case, your placement of special interest is depressing your ascendant ruler.
In astrology there is this thing called an aspect. There are various types of aspects. Co-presence is when two planets share a house, sextile is when they're within a range of three houses, square is when they're within a range of four houses, trine is a range of five and opposition is a range of seven. Any planets that are in houses right next to each other or six houses away, however, are in aversion. Aversion is when planets do not see and interact with each other. This is bad for your Saturn, because Saturn is in a house ruled by Mars but cannot connect with it to receive support. Although fsr in your chart the engine you're using is saying there's an opposition between Mars and Saturn instead of aversion, which seems like nonsense to me. Both in Placidus and Whole Sign, your planets should be six houses away.

That's the wrong way to think about the outer planets. Their influence isn't fainter, nor even "subtler" as a synonym of faint, but rather has been tricky to cartograph within an individual's psyche. The current descriptions out there regarding what exact influences Uranus and Neptune and also Pluto have upon one mind at the time of birth, even without delving into the energies of particular signs, are woefully insufficient to understanding them.

The murky sense we get is that Uranus represents somehow a "higher" part of the mind, in a layer above Mercury; while Neptune represents a "deeper" part of the mind, in a layer sub Mercury. That seems easy to grasp initially until you try to explicitly mentally map out the psyche and its whole physiology (so to speak). It takes on too much of a nebulous character that yields no specific information.

It is extremely easy to say, "Mercury represents the operation of the rational part of our minds." And go through the signs and write up accurate detailed descriptions of real life consequences. But nobody has seem to have done the same for Uranus and Neptune---nobody has seemed to say exactly how differently Uranus and Neptune in Capricorns *think*.

It's an area of research opportunity.

The nocturnal signs, numbers 7 through 12, generally speaking are concerned less with the world as it is given and appears to be and more with what is unseen and potential, compared to the diurnal signs.

As the social order continues to decay and degenerate, one must further and further debase themselves in order to stay afloat and get ahead. It becomes too ever more difficult to fix things or devise a roadmap toward fixing things. So people of very limited understanding are forced to operate by the terms set and do not have the potential to change the rules.

The nocturnal signs possess, generally speaking, a greater discernment than the diurnal ones, which allows them to be forces of change in contrast. The phrase used is "generally speaking", because not all of them measure up when you zoom in. Libra are known for being degenerates themselves and also weak-willed; but Nietzsche was a Libra. Sagittarius are known for being fairly normal and well-adjusted to whatever life gives them.

Pisces as has been mentioned is most in tune with the world beyond and unseen reality. Aquarius is most tapped into metaphysical truths. Capricorn is the most naturally suited to the wielding of power. Scorpio seems to have a blend of all the talents as a Jack.

The truth of our world is far more monstrous than most people know. Frivolous hylics like most diurnal signs tend to be could never hope to dismantle it, or even realize the disaster around them.

What is 5D?

A 3D being can only perceive time linearly, going forward.

A 4D being can travel backwards and forwards on a single timeline.

A 5D being is experiencing multiple lives on multiple timelines simultaneously. Different spokes of the same wheel.

>>33816123
A glass of poison is sitting on a table
3rd dimensional thinking: If I drink the poison I will die, I cannot drink the poison.
4rth dimensional thinking: I can drink the poison and die or I can walk away from the table, both are equally valid options.
5th dimensional thinking: I can drink the poison and transmute it in my body to water and I will not die.

Essentially you can think of it as having more pathways to choose from beyond linear cause and effect. (Personally I think 5th dimensional living is within the laws of cause and effect just in a higher dimension)

posts.com:
It's not, he suffers much more. People don't understand that the second coming involves him coming back as a despised, rejected and persecuted man before he achieves glory and messianic status.

"For as the lightning, that lighteneth out of the one part under heaven, shineth unto the other part under heaven; so shall also the Son of man be in his day. But first must he suffer many things, and be rejected of this generation."

"This generation" doesn't mean just the people alive in Jesus time. The translation of "generation" from the Greek term is misleading and is a much broader reference inclusive of all of the descendants of a people/civilization. The Son of Man will be rejected and judged by the world in the latter days.

From Isaiah the Son of Man (Messiah) will be as such:

"For he shall grow up before him as a tender plant, and as a root out of a dry ground: he hath no form nor comeliness; and when we shall see him, there is no beauty that we should desire him.

He is despised and rejected of men; a man of sorrows, and acquainted with grief: and we hid as it were our faces from him; he was despised, and we esteemed him not.

Surely he hath borne our griefs, and carried our sorrows: yet we did esteem him stricken, smitten of God, and afflicted.

But he was wounded for our transgressions, he was bruised for our iniquities: the chastisement of our peace was upon him; and with his stripes we are healed."

posts.name: Puppy
posts.com:
"And there shall come forth a rod out of the stem of Jesse, and a Branch shall grow out of his roots:

And the spirit of the LORD shall rest upon him, the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of counsel and might, the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the LORD;

And shall make him of quick understanding in the fear of the LORD: and he shall not judge after the sight of his eyes, neither reprove after the hearing of his ears:

But with righteousness shall he judge the poor, and reprove with equity for the meek of the earth: and he shall smite the earth with the rod of his mouth, and with the breath of his lips shall he slay the wicked.

And righteousness shall be the girdle of his loins, and faithfulness the girdle of his reins."

It twice emphasizes his understanding and learning "fear of the Lord". This can only come about by him transgressing and being punished by the Lord. The Son of Man doesn't arrive on Earth as a ready made King and Messiah. He is the reincarnation of the Son/Christ but like any human incarnation he is a new and unique individual who has to start from scratch with no prior memory from earlier existence. He grows up as a flawed human who is then put through the furnace of affliction by God and molded into greatness. He lives the full human experience and knows and understands the plight of humans and learns how to overcome it. He makes all the mistakes normal humans do and so he has compassion and humility and judges justly.

posts.sub: My experience when I was eighteen years old. I am now sixty one years old.
posts.com:
I am now sixty-one years old.

When I was eighteen I was held hostage one night by another man, threatened with death and sexually assaulted.

He said he would "throw me head down off the balcony if I didn't cooperate".

The next day I went to make a report at the police station in the Kapelstraat in Hilversum.

I will never forget how I walked through the hall and reported to the counter.

“How can I be of service to you?” asked the agent behind the counter.

“I'm here to file a report,” I said.

"For what"?

“For rape,” I replied.

The officer scanned the hall for a possible female victim. Only women are raped.

If you claim to have been raped as a man, you are either crazy or a liar.

Or a deranged liar.

However, he did not see a woman standing in the hall.

“Who is the victim?” he asked me.

"Me".

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
In horoscopic astrology, a Saturn return is an astrological transit that occurs when the planet Saturn returns to the same ecliptic longitude that it occupied at the moment of a person's birth. While the planet may not first reach the exact location until the person is 29 or 30 years old, the influence of the Saturn return is considered to start in the person's late twenties, notably the age of 27.

Psychologically, the first Saturn return is seen as the time of reaching full adulthood, and being faced, perhaps for the first time, with adult challenges and responsibilities.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: The phenomenon is described by Western astrologers as influencing a person's life development at roughly 29.5 year intervals,[citation needed] though the planetary influence may be felt for a few years before the exact conjunction, and variable orbits of the planets can also make the time period longer or shorter. These intervals or "returns" coincide with the approximate time it takes the planet Saturn to make one orbit around the sun, roughly 29.5 years. Western astrologers believe that, as Saturn "returns" to the degree in its orbit occupied at the time of birth, a person crosses over a major threshold and enters the next stage of life. With the first Saturn return, a person leaves youth behind and enters adulthood. With the second return, maturity. And with the third and usually final return, a person enters wise old age. These periods are estimated to occur at roughly the ages of 27–31, 56–60 and 84–90. A fourth return—for those who live to see the age of 114–118—is sufficiently rare that it is not given coverage in the astrological literature.

posts.name: Puppy
posts.com:
YHWH basically means "the one who is". The thing about the eternal creator/father is it was never created and so is nameless. "Yahweh" is just the phonetic form in english. The name very much refers to God the eternal father/creator in the monotheistic sense and is the same heavenly father that Christ speaks of. Trying to cast YHWH as a different deity to the Christian God is just ignorant, modern day revisionism based on false beliefs and perceptions of the nature of God. Yes God is good and God loves mankind and by this we have grace. By grace, life is good in its totality - it all ends well and is a desirable, precious experience. But its totality involves finite periods of experiencing great evil and severe suffering for necessary purposes - eternal life in blissful paradise has no meaning without having experienced everything that it is not. What seems so cruel, unfair and unjustified in life from our ignorant little incarnate perspective, is in the grand scheme actually our loving God's gift to us that we will later appreciate. God is both good and evil. All of the evil in life isn't just by accident - God devised it all. God does horrible, cruel, twisted things to humans, intentionally and without remorse. But they are temporary and even if we suffer death in this mortal form the soul's continues it's greater journey. So if YHWH's (God's) dealings with men and the trials he puts them through don't reconcile with a fluffy ideal of God people have conjured up for comfort that is just human ignorance. Modern human notions of entitlement and rights are rubbish. We take God's grace and mercy totally for granted and don't think for a second how terrible things really could be.

The Gnostic Gospel of Phillip summed this up well - "In this world there is good and evil, but the good of the world is not really good and the evil of the world is not really evil. After this world there is evil that is really evil: this is called the middle."
